results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of even permutations of {1,2,...,n} with no fixed points and having k excedances (n>=1; k>=1).
comment: Sum of entries in row n = A000321(n).
link: R. Mantaci and F. Rakotondrajao, Exceedingly deranging!, Advances in Appl. Math., 30 (2003), 177-188.
example: T(4,2)=3 because the even derangements of {1,2,3,4} are 3412, 2143 and 4321.
maple: G:=((1-t)*exp(-t*z)/(1-t*exp((1-t)*z))-(t*exp(-z)-exp(-t*z))/(1-t))*1/2: Gser:=simplify(series(G,z=0,15)): for n to 11 do P[n]:=sort(expand(factorial(n)*coeff(Gser,z,n))) end do: 0; for n to 11 do seq(coeff(P[n],t,j),j=1..n-1) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
